ranked_diseases.explanation: Usher Syndrome Type 1 is characterized by congenital sensorineural hearing impairment and is a common cause of deaf-blindness.
Waardenburg Syndrome Type 1 includes sensorineural hearing loss as a key feature, along with pigmentation abnormalities.
Pendred Syndrome is associated with sensorineural hearing impairment and often includes thyroid dysfunction.
Alport Syndrome can present with sensorineural hearing loss, typically alongside kidney disease.
Branchiootorenal Syndrome 1 includes sensorineural hearing impairment and may involve branchial and renal anomalies.
